rsa.title: RSA Encryption Visualized
rsa.intro: RSA is a public-key cryptosystem widely used for secure data transmission. Let's explore how it works, step by step.

1.title: Step 1: Choose Prime Numbers
1.description: RSA security relies on the difficulty of factoring large numbers. We start by choosing two different prime numbers, p and q.
1.security_note: ‚ö†Ô∏è In practice, these would be very large primes (hundreds of digits). We use small primes here for educational purposes.

2.title: Step 2: Calculate n (Modulus)
2.description: We multiply our two primes to get n, which is the modulus for both the public and private keys.

3.title: Step 3: Calculate œÜ(n) - Euler's Totient
3.description: Euler's totient function œÜ(n) counts how many numbers less than n are coprime to n (share no common factors except 1).

4.title: Step 4: Choose Public Exponent e
4.description: The public exponent e must satisfy: 1 < e < œÜ(n) and gcd(e, œÜ(n)) = 1

5.title: Step 5: Calculate Private Exponent d
5.description: The private exponent d is the modular multiplicative inverse of e modulo œÜ(n).

6.title: Step 6: Encrypt a Message
6.description: To encrypt a message m, we calculate: c = m^e mod n

7.title: Step 7: Decrypt the Message
7.description: To decrypt the ciphertext c, we use the private key: m = c^d mod n
